ygData.msgSnippet: ... The profiles and modules are built into the heritrix jar with a while now. When heritrix goes looking for core files such as default profiles, it first

 dist?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281
X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

Tom Emerson wrote:

> Using CVS HEAD the built binary distro does not include conf/profiles
> or conf/modules: only the three top-level files are included. The
> upshot is that if you try to create a new profile based on an existing
> one (though i'm not sure where it is finding these), it fails,
> claiming that it cannot find seeds.txt.

The profiles and modules are built into the heritrix jar with a while 
now. When heritrix goes looking for core files such as default profiles, 
it first checks the filesystem and if its unable to find needed files 
here, it goes to the classpath.  The reason for moving core files on to 
the classpath rather than leave them out on the filesystem is because in 
some contexts, e.g. heritrix packaged as a WAR file, finding files and 
directories on disk gets tricky.

I tried making a new profile with the last build from 
crawltools.archive.org and it went fine for me.  Where do you get the 
failed to find seeds.txt message? Is it when you try to create new 
profile from an old profile?  Is the old profile one of the defaults or 
one of your own making?

Thanks Tom,
St.Ack


>
> 'maven distro' succeeds without an error. I'm still using maven
> 1.0-rc2 --- could this be problematic in the 1.5 versions?
>
